**Frozen Ramparts** is a Level 3 [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") spell that temporarily covers all [walls](/Wall "Wall") within 2 tiles of the caster with ice. These ice-covered walls will inflict `1d(1 + 0.3 * power)` [cold](/Cold "Cold") damage[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) on any monster that stands next to them. It does not check [evasion](/Ev "Ev"), and may slow down [cold-blooded](/Cold-blooded "Cold-blooded") creatures. The caster and their allies are immune to the spell's effects. If the caster moves, this spell will end prematurely.

While the spell is active, attempting to cast the spell again will fail (but will not waste any time).

[Ice Elementalists](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist") begin with this spell in their libraries.

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [1.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [2 History](#History)
- [3 References](#References)

## Strategy

Frozen Ramparts deals significant damage over its duration to all enemies. However, it requires you to remain still and keep your enemies next to walls. It is most effective in corridors, but can perform adequately in semi-open areas so long as you can still position your foe(s) next to a wall.

Overall, it is a strong spell that never misses. Useful for fighting [evasive](/Ev "Ev") enemies like [killer bees](/Killer_bee "Killer bee"). It's also good against [cold-blooded](/Cold-blooded "Cold-blooded") enemies, like [adders](/Adder "Adder"), [water moccasins](/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin"), and even [hydras](/Hydra "Hydra"), as it can slow them from a short distance.

Do note that intelligent enemies may attempt to avoid ice-covered walls if (and only if) their health is low enough; if you need to reactivate the spell, you may need to wait until your foes are in position in order to catch them in the area. Unlike [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud"), weaker monsters with full HP will charge into the Ramparts without care.

### Tips & Tricks

- [Ozocubu's Armour](/Ozocubu%27s_Armour "Ozocubu's Armour") shares its spell school, movement restrictions, and even spell level with Frozen Ramparts. The two spells possess impressive natural synergy.
- Despite their similarity to walls, [trees](/Tree "Tree") are not affected by Frozen Ramparts, making the spell of little use in forested areas like the [Swamp](/Swamp "Swamp").
- *Any* change in position will break the ramparts, be it voluntary (movement, [blinking](/Blink "Blink")) or not ([Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance"), being [trampled](/Trample "Trample")). Take care to position yourself to maximize the spell's effectiveness, and consider using a different spell against creatures that can force you to move.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Frozen Ramparts ignored [AC](/AC "AC"), but did less damage: `1d(2 + 0.2 * power)`.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), certain involuntary movements, such as an [elephant](/Elephant "Elephant")'s [trample](/Trample "Trample"), did not disrupt the Ramparts.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), you could move without ending the spell.
- Frozen Ramparts was added in [0.25](/0.25 "0.25").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-damage.cc:4418](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-damage.cc#L4418) (0.31.0)

Encases surrounding walls with ice for a short time. Foes that wander near the icy walls will be damaged, and this may temporarily slow cold-blooded creatures. Each victim is only ever affected by one icy wall at a time.

The ice will crack and fall away if the caster moves to a new position.

Frozen Ramparts is a Level 3 Ice Magic spell that temporarily covers all walls within 2 tiles of the caster with ice. These ice-covered walls will inflict 1d(1 + 0.3 * power) cold damage[1] on any monster that stands next to them. It does not check evasion, and may slow down cold-blooded creatures. The caster and their allies are immune to the spell's effects. If the caster moves, this spell will end prematurely.

While the spell is active, attempting to cast the spell again will fail (but will not waste any time).

Ice Elementalists begin with this spell in their libraries.

Contents

  • 1 Strategy
    • 1.1 Tips & Tricks
  • 2 History

Strategy

Frozen Ramparts deals significant damage over its duration to all enemies. However, it requires you to remain still and keep your enemies next to walls. It is most effective in corridors, but can perform adequately in semi-open areas so long as you can still position your foe(s) next to a wall.

Overall, it is a strong spell that never misses. Useful for fighting evasive enemies like killer bees. It's also good against cold-blooded enemies, like adders, water moccasins, and even hydras, as it can slow them from a short distance.

Do note that intelligent enemies may attempt to avoid ice-covered walls if (and only if) their health is low enough; if you need to reactivate the spell, you may need to wait until your foes are in position in order to catch them in the area. Unlike clouds, weaker monsters with full HP will charge into the Ramparts without care.

Tips & Tricks

  • Ozocubu's Armour shares its spell school, movement restrictions, and even spell level with Frozen Ramparts. The two spells possess impressive natural synergy.
  • Despite their similarity to walls, trees are not affected by Frozen Ramparts, making the spell of little use in forested areas like the Swamp.
  • Any change in position will break the ramparts, be it voluntary (movement, blinking) or not (Force Lance, being trampled). Take care to position yourself to maximize the spell's effectiveness, and consider using a different spell against creatures that can force you to move.

History

  • Prior to 0.29, Frozen Ramparts ignored AC, but did less damage: 1d(2 + 0.2 * power).
  • Prior to 0.27, certain involuntary movements, such as an elephant's trample, did not disrupt the Ramparts.
  • Prior to 0.26, you could move without ending the spell.
  • Frozen Ramparts was added in 0.25.
